It is often characterized by a pressing pain or a sensation of heaviness, typically felt in the chest area under the breastbone (sternum), but it can also be experienced in the shoulder, arm, neck, or jaw. Angina episodes occur when the heart's demand for oxygen exceeds the supply available from the blood, often triggered by physical exertion, emotional stress, extreme temperatures, heavy meals, cigarette smoking, or alcohol consumption.
